config.name: marcus.cjh
config.title: Full Stack Engineer & Cloud Architect
config.subtitle: Transforming ideas into scalable digital solutions
config.summary: Experienced IT Professional with 8+ years delivering scalable cloud-native solutions across multiple industries. Proven expertise in AWS and Alibaba Cloud with specialization in serverless architecture, DevOps automation, and full-stack development. Certified in AWS, Alibaba Cloud, and Google Cloud. Strong background in big data analytics, enterprise application development, and cloud infrastructure with hands-on experience from research to production systems.

defaults.title: Marcus Chan | Full Stack Engineer & Cloud Architect
defaults.description: Experienced Software Engineer specializing in cloud technologies, data engineering, and full-stack development. Certified in AWS, Alibaba Cloud, and Google Cloud.
defaults.author: Marcus Chan

meta.title: Marcus Chan | Software Engineer
meta.keywords: Software Engineer, Cloud Computing, AWS, Alibaba Cloud, Data Engineering, Full Stack Developer, Singapore

modalContent.title: Real-Time Incident Response System
modalContent.description: An automated incident response system built with Amazon Connect that triggers escalation calls when alerts are received. The system uses AWS Lambda to orchestrate outbound calls, with automatic escalation to secondary contacts if the first contact doesn't respond. Features include call status monitoring, DynamoDB logging, and SNS integration for alert management.

modalContent.title: Endless Jumper Game
modalContent.description: A fun endless runner game built in just 2 hours using Amazon Q AI assistant. Features include power-ups, increasing difficulty, and smooth gameplay mechanics. The game demonstrates rapid prototyping and AI-assisted development.

modalContent.title: ApsaraChat Live: Real-time monitoring of COVID-19 with DataV
modalContent.description: A webinar where I was invited to speak about utilizing Alibaba Cloud's DataV for real-time data visualization and monitoring.

modalContent.title: Slack Bot
modalContent.description: A custom Slack bot built to automate workspace tasks and streamline team workflows using Python, Slack API, and AWS services.

modalContent.title: Webcam Test
modalContent.description: A static webpage designed for testing your webcam before going live, ensuring you look great before presenting yourself to the world.

modalContent.title: Personal Portfolio
modalContent.description: A dynamic personal portfolio website built with TypeScript, Vite, and modern web technologies. Features include interactive timeline, project showcase, and dynamic content loading from JSON configuration.

modalContent.title: ShareShed: Library of Things
modalContent.description: A Brisbane-based 'Library of Things' platform enabling members to borrow items with annual membership. Built as part of DECO3801 course using Django, replacing third-party system limitations with a responsive, role-based web application. Features include membership management, catalogue browsing, lending/returns, operating hours configuration, and admin dashboard.

modalContent.title: INFS3208/INFS7208 Cloud Computing Project
modalContent.description: University of Queensland cloud computing project implementing a scalable web application using Cassandra NoSQL database, Spark Job Server for data processing, and Docker + Nginx for containerized deployment. Awarded Project Excellence Award (Best Project Demo) by Prof Xue Li in Oct 2018.

details: Research & Development Center - Singapore
• Built Taxi Simulator application using HTML, Java, JavaScript, and Google Maps API to model real-world transportation patterns
• Integrated Open Source Routing Machine (OSRM) to simulate taxi interactions and optimize passenger demand forecasting
• Created data visualization dashboards analyzing taxi sharing efficiency and route optimization using historical traffic data
Yokohama Research Lab - Yokohama, Japan
• Developed scalable Big Data Graph Visualizer web application using Apache Solr and Apache Hadoop for large-scale data processing
• Developed Java backend services and JavaScript frontend components enabling interactive exploration of complex graph datasets
• Performed performance benchmarking of graph algorithms on distributed Linux systems, identifying optimal solutions for production use
